command-def.name: cut - cut out selected portions of each line of a file
command-def.synopsis: cut -b list [-n] [file ...] cut -c list [file ...] cut -f list [-d delim] [-s] [file ...]

options.option: The list specifies fields, separated in the input by the field delimiter character (see the -d option.) Output fields are separated by a single occurrence of the field delimiter character.
Use delim as the field delimiter character instead of the tab character
Suppress lines with no field delimiter characters. Unless specified, lines with no delimiters are passed through unmodified.

Do not split multi-byte characters. Characters will only be output if at least one byte is selected, and, after a prefix of zero or more unselected bytes, the rest of the bytes that form the character are selected.

operands.operand: The options defining the options for the cut command.
